article_title: 22 Years Since 8 People Killed In Plane Crash
article_text:
Sioux Falls, SD

Sunday marks the 22nd anniversary of a tragedy that touched every corner, every community, every family of South Dakota.

On April 19 1993, an airplane carrying Governor George Mickelson and seven others crashed in an Iowa farm field after the propeller hub broke. There were no survivors.

The group, which included Roland Dolly, Ron Reed, Angus Anson, David Birkeland, Roger Hainje and pilots Ron Becker and Dave Hansen, was returning from an economic development meeting in Cincinnati.

article_summary:
Sioux Falls, SDSunday marks the 22nd anniversary of a tragedy that touched every corner, every community, every family of South Dakota.
On April 19 1993, an airplane carrying Governor George Mickelson and seven others crashed in an Iowa farm field after the propeller hub broke.
The group, which included Roland Dolly, Ron Reed, Angus Anson, David Birkeland, Roger Hainje and pilots Ron Becker and Dave Hansen, was returning from an economic development meeting in Cincinnati.
All Rights Reserved.
There were no survivors.
